hook.text: Thomas Edison held 1,093 patents. Each one gave him a legal monopoly on an invention for years.

buildup.text: A patent grants the inventor exclusive rights to make, use, and sell an invention for a limited period.

discovery.text: Utility patents last 20 years from filing. Design patents last 15 years. Both require a formal application.

twist.text: In exchange, the inventor must publicly disclose how the invention works. Patents trade secrecy for protection.

climax.text: After expiration, anyone can use the invention. That's why generic drugs appear after pharmaceutical patents end.

punchline.text: A patent is a deal: share your invention, get temporary exclusivity.
